#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Lao phrasebook
#Text=Lao
#Text=( ພາສາລາວ pháa-sǎa láo ) is the main language of Laos .
#Text=Thai
#Text=is also closely related to Lao , and the Isaan dialect spoken in the northeast is , with minor differences in vocabulary aside , virtually identical to Lao .
#Text=It is best not to try to learn Lao from local magazines , local books or the internet as they are sometimes fully Thai language ( and completely not Lao ) .
#Text=The best way to learn Lao is to learn Thai first , then learn Lao while listening to Lao people speaking .
#Text=Pronunciation guide
#Text=Lao is a tonal language with six tones in the Vientiane dialect : low , mid , high , rising , high falling , and low falling .
#Text=Meanings are dependent on the tone , so try not to inflect your sentences ; in particular , questions should be pronounced as flat statements , without the rising intonation ( " ... yes ?

#Text=The French-style  Vientiane " , for example , is more accurately spelled " Wiang Chan " in English .

column1: #Text=Wikivoyage uses a modern English-based orthography modeled on the Thai system , but the French transliterations have been noted below when appropriate .
#Text=Vowels
#Text=Lao has a complicated set of vowels that distinguishes between vowel length ( short and long ) and vowel position ( front and back ) .
#Text=Vowel signs are always written around consonants .
#Text=French transliterations use " ou " for " u " ( eg . " L ou ang Prabang " ) and often tag an unpronounced " e " at the end of words to stop the consonant from being swallowed ( eg .
#Text=" Kayson e Phomvihan e " ) .
#Text=i : like in the ' i ' in ' nit '
#Text=ii : like in the ' ee ' in ' beer ' or ' Feet '
#Text=a : like in the ' u ' in ' bum '
#Text=aa : like in the ' a ' in ' father '
#Text=ae : like in the ' a ' in ' fat '
#Text=e : like in the ' e ' in ' fence '
#Text=eh : like in the ' a ' in ' bait '
#Text=u : like in the ' u ' for ' fruit '
#Text=ou : like in the ' oo ' in ' mood '
#Text=aw : like in the ' aw ' in ' saw '
#Text=am : like in the ' um ' in ' drum '
#Text=oe : not found in English , but similar to the ' uh ' in ' huh '
#Text=eu : not found in English , but similar to the ' i ' in ' sir ' or the ' eux ' from the French ' deux '
#Text=Consonants
#Text=Lao distinguishes between aspirated ( " with a puff of air " ) and unaspirated ( " without a puff of air " ) consonants .
#Text=Unaspirated consonants exist in English too , but never alone : compare the sound of ' p ' in " pot " ( aspirated ) and " spot " ( unaspirated ) .
#Text=Many English speakers find it helpful to pronounce an imperceptible little " m " in front to ' stop ' the puff .
#Text=In romanized Lao , the distinction is usually represented by writing aspirated consonants with " h " and unaspirated ones without it .
#Text=In particular , " ph " represents a hard aspirated ' p ' and not a soft ' f ' , and Phongsali is thus pronounced " Pongsalee " .
#Text=Likewise , " th " is a hard aspirated ' t ' and hence That Luang is pronounced " Tat Luang " .
#Text=b : like ' b ' in " bed "
#Text=c : not used in Wikivoyage , but in other romanizations may represent ' s '
#Text=d : like ' d ' in " dog "
#Text=f : like ' f ' in " fan "
#Text=g : not used in Wikivoyage , but in other romanizations may represent unaspirated ' k '
#Text=h : like ' h ' in " help "
#Text=j : like ' dg ' in " edge "
#Text=k : like ' k ' in " skate " ( unaspirated )
#Text=kh : like ' c ' in " cat " ( aspirated )
#Text=l : like ' l ' in " love "
#Text=m : like ' m ' in " mother "
#Text=n : like ' n ' in " nice "
#Text=ny : like ' ni ' in " onion " , can also be used at the beginning of words
#Text=ng : like ' ng ' in " sing " , can also be used at the beginning of words
#Text=p : like ' p ' in " spit " ( unaspirated )
#Text=ph : like ' p ' in " pig " ( aspirated )
#Text=r : not used the modern orthography , should be pronounced as ' l ' , ' h ' or ignored
#Text=s : like ' ss ' in " hiss " ,
#Text=t : like ' t ' sound in " stab "
#Text=th : like ' t ' in " top "
#Text=v : not used in Wikivoyage , but in other romanizations may represent ' w '
#Text=w : like ' w ' in " weight "
#Text=y : like ' y ' in " yes "
#Text=x : like ' ss ' in " hiss " , completely identical to ' s '
#Text=Basics
#Text=Hello . : ສະບາຍດີ ( Sa-bai-Dee . )
#Text=What 's Up ? : ( Pen Jung Dai ? )
#Text=How are you ? : ( Sa-bai-Dee Baw ? )
#Text=Fine , thank you . : ( Dee , Kup-Jai . )
#Text=What is your name ? : ( J âo Seuh Maen/Bhen Nyung ? )
#Text=My name is ______ . : ( Khàwy Seuh Maen/Bpen _____ . )
#Text=Please . : ກະລຸນາ ( Kawlunaa )
#Text=Thank you . : ຂອບໃຈ ( Khawp Jai )
#Text=It 's nothing . : ( Baw Pen Nyung . )
#Text=Yes . : ( Maen Laeow/Doi/Eur/Jao )
#Text=No. : ບໍ່ ( Baw )
#Text=Excuse me/I 'm Sorry . ( Begging Pardon ) : ( Khǎw Thôht )
#Text=Goodbye and Take Care : ( Sôhk Dee Deuh )
#Text=Do you speak English ? : ( Jâo Wâo Pháa-Sǎa Ung-Kit Dai Baw ? )
#Text=I ca n't speak English very well . : ( Khàwy Baw Wâo Pháa-Sǎa Ung-Kit Dai Dee )
#Text=I ca n't speak ____ . : ( Khàwy Wâo Pháa-Sǎa ____ Baw Dai . )
#Text=Please speak slowly . : ( Kalunaa , Wâo Sah-Saah )
#Text=Do you understand ? : ( Jâo Khào Jai Baw ? )
#Text=-- Yes . I understand . : ( Maen Laeow . Khàwy Khào Jai )
#Text=-- No .
#Text=I do n't understand . : ( Baw . Khàwy Baw Khào Jai )
#Text=Go to sleep : ໄປນອນ ( Bpai Náwn )
#Text=Where is the bathroom ? : ( Hàwng Nâm Yuu Sǎi ? )
#Text=( Ethnicity ) I am ____ . : ( Khoy Pen Khon ____ . )
#Text=Problems
#Text=Leave me alone . : ( Ya gwuan khoy )
#Text=Do n't touch me ! : ( Ya jup khoy )
#Text=I 'll call the police .
#Text=: ( Khoy si toh jaeng dtum louat . )
#Text=Police ! : Police ! ( Dtum louat ! )
#Text=Stop ! Thief ! : Stop ! Thief ! ( Yud ! Kee Luck )
#Text=Can you help me ? .
#Text=: I need your help . ( ' Suay khoy dai boh ' )
#Text=It 's an emergency . : ສຸກເສີນ . ( souk sern )
#Text=I 'm lost . : ( Khoy lohng taang )
#Text=I lost my wallet . : ( Khoy seeuh gkapow )
#Text=I lost my bag . : ( Khoy seeuh tong )
#Text=I 'm sick . : ( Khoy pben kai/Khoy boh sabai )
#Text=I 've been injured . : ( Khoy jep/Khoy Theug baad jep .
#Text=)
#Text=I need a doctor . : I need a doctor .
#Text=( Khoy tong kan Maw )
#Text=Can I
#Text=use/borrow your phone ? : ( Khoy sai/yeum tolasup dai boh ? )
#Text=May I talk to _______ ? ( Khoy lom num _______ ? )
#Text=I do n't understand : koi
#Text=boh kow jai
